summary: After the Sept. 11 attacks, insurers generally stopped covering terrorism risk. Through the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act, Congress sought to ensure available, affordable commercial insurance for this risk. Under this program, the government and insurers share losses. title: Terrorism Risk Insurance: Program Changes Have Reduced Federal Fiscal Exposure
